places.generalDescription: Las Caba√±as Beach, also known as Marimegmeg Beach, is a must-visit destination in El Nido, Palawan. This picturesque beach offers stunning sunset views and a relaxed atmosphere. It features a beautiful stretch of sand bordered by coconut plantations, providing the perfect setting for unwinding and enjoying the natural beauty. The beach is lined with bars and restaurants where visitors can savor drinks and snacks while taking in the remarkable scenery.

sources.snippet: Las Cabanas Beach is a must-visit destination for those who want to experience the beauty of El Nido‚Äôs inland beaches. Located just 5 kilometers away from the town proper, Las Cabanas is known for its creamy white sand and towering coconut palm trees. Unlike other beaches in El Nido, Las Cabanas has a line of resorts and other establishments that make it a more developed area, but still clean and serene.

sources.snippet: Less than a 15-minute drive from El Nido town, Las Cabanas Beach is famed as a place to watch the sunset. Catch the sunset here at 5 p.m., an hour before sundown. A slew of restaurants with options ranging from local to international cuisine, beach bars, and chic resorts are located in this area, such as the Maremegmeg Beach Club, Muatala Hotel, and Las Cabanas Beach Resort.

places.generalDescription: Hidden Beach in El Nido, Palawan is a secluded paradise with towering rock formations and a peaceful sandy beach. It's part of the island hopping tours that take visitors to various attractions including Secret Beach, Matinloc Shrine, and Helicopter Island. The area offers abundant coral and opportunities for activities like kayaking in Big Lagoon. Visitors can also explore other nearby beaches such as Talisay Island and enjoy the amenities of the surrounding hotels.

sources.snippet: Unless you are a local of El Nido, this is one place that is commonly unknown to people from elsewhere, the name of the island even already says it why‚Äîit is as hidden as its name, the Hidden Beach. There is also a good reason why this beach is also called as so‚Äîthe place is not always accessible, even to those who are already aware of the place. The level of the waters around where the beach is located dictates whether or not you can get into the place‚Äîvery mysterious, indeed.

places.name: El Nido Tours "Sea Quest" - island hopping and expeditions to Coron.

reviews.text:
I can't say enough good things about our 3-day, 2-night expedition! From the moment we stepped on board, the tour guide and the entire crew made us feel so welcome and taken care of. They were all so friendly and created such a fun, happy atmosphere for the whole trip.

The scenery was just breathtaking. We snorkeled in so many beautiful spots and relaxed on pristine white sand beaches. Getting to walk through a classic Filipino village was a really special experience. I was also impressed with how clean and neat our cabins were. One of the best parts was the food-it was delicious, and they made sure we never went hungry, with plenty of snacks and drinks always available. The evening karaoke with all the guests and crew was hilarious and such a great way to bond!

Our group of 12 felt like the perfect size for the boat, creating a nice, intimate vibe. The only downside was that one cabin didn't have a fan, which made it uncomfortably hot for sleeping. Aside from that, it was a truly wonderful trip, and I would do it again in a heartbeat.

Amazing 3 days trip from El Nido to Coron. The crew onboard was very kind, helpful and at our service at all times. Chef cooked amazing (and loads!) of local / homemade food. The camps were very clean and well equipped. We saw beautiful beaches and crystal clear water, nice snorkeling spots and also karaoke sessions üôåüèΩ.
We had some delay for departure the second day due to technical issues (I mention that we were on a beautiful island, not very disturbing to wait there).   To apologize and make it up to us, Sea Quest offered to each guest an extra day of choice on a boat expedition. We got the ultimate tour 2 days after, lunch, beers and kayaks included , totally free of charge. Amazing service, thanks again guys, you made our trip wonderful

The cruise from Coron to El Nido was a great experience overall. Everything was very well organized, and the scenery along the way was absolutely stunning.

The accommodation was simple but clean and comfortable, which suited the adventure-style of the trip. The food was a real highlight - fresh, tasty, and varied throughout the cruise.

The crew was kind and welcoming, although we would have appreciated more background information or stories about the places we visited - a bit more context would have made the experience even richer.

The boat was fully booked (30 guests), so it did feel a bit tight at times, especially during meals or when everyone was on board.

Despite those small points, it was a very enjoyable trip and one I would definitely recommend. A beautiful way to explore this part of the Philippines!

places.name: Mad Monkey Nacpan Beach

reviews.text:
I came to Palawan with the hope of having an amazing time, and Mad Monkey Nacpan made sure I had even more than that. The beach is absolutely breathtaking during the day and transforms into a peaceful paradise at night. The vibe is the perfect balance of laid-back and lively, with a strong sense of community that makes everyone feel welcome. Jase, one of the Filipino guest experience staff, made me feel right at home with his warm and genuine energy.

I also really appreciated the hospitality of the general manager, who was always willing to give helpful tips to make my trip even better. It's that extra effort from the team that made the experience unforgettable. If you're looking for a place that blends adventure, nature, great parties, and authentic connections, Mad Monkey Nacpan is definitely a standout.

Absolutely loved our stay at Mad Monkey Nacpan Beach! From the moment we arrived, we were greeted by James, who was incredibly welcoming and set the tone for an amazing stay. The atmosphere was full of good vibes, with tons of fun games and social activities that made it super easy to meet other travelers. üòç

We really appreciated the individual bathrooms - such a nice touch that added to the overall comfort. The food was also delicious, with plenty of options.

Massive thanks to James and the rest of the Mad Monkey staff for making our stay so memorable. üôåüèùÔ∏è

Mad Monkey El Nido hostel, was a great stay experience! The location is insanely beautiful, literally on the Napcan beach. The service was great, and the people working there are very warmhearted. Also, their cocktail and food selection is very enjoyable. Not to mention, their cabana rooms are such a vibe, and make you want to live on an island forever. It's a very social hostel with many activities and opportunities to mingle. I will be coming back for sure :)!

sources.snippet: Lio Beach is more than just another beach in El Nido, it‚Äôs a tourism estate made up of resorts, restaurants and retailers. If you‚Äôre looking for a day out at the beach with all the facilities and amenities at your fingertips, Lio Beach is where you need to go.

places.name: Lio Beach

reviews.text: Lio Beach is the best beach of El Nido in my opinion. It is a quiet and clean beach with free parking available. There is plenty of shade from the palm trees and a few good restaurants nearby to grab something to eat or drink. Great place to relax and watch the sunset.

It is simply beautiful and quiet. You could not ask more from a beach. Crowd is just enough, no one rowdy and you can get photos like mine easily without needing to wake up too early or go at weird hours.

The sand is not super fine but my standard for that is pretty high. The water is clear, and you don't know it but it just a few meters ahead of you people can go swimming.

Lio Beach should be considered a national treasure with a stunning sandy beach running from coastal jungle to jungle hills. The jetty in the middle of the beach is a great landmark and helps tie it all together. The local bars and vendors are all beach themed and it's a great vibe overall. Well worth a trip if you're in the area.
Almost feels like something out of pirates of the Caribbean

places.generalDescription: Nacpan Beach Glamping, part of the H Hospitality Group, offers a unique beachfront experience with 9 chic glamping tents overlooking the stunning Nacpan Beach. The resort provides an extraordinary setting with its collection of airy permanent tents amidst palm trees and shrubs, creating an exotic island atmosphere. Guests can enjoy easy access to nearby attractions such as Nagkalit-kalit Waterfalls and El Nido Lio Airport.

sources.snippet: Nacpan Beach Glamping is a unique way to experience the beauty of Nacpan Beach. Set 45 minutes north of El Nido Town, this exotic getaway is a great way to spend some time in nature. The tents are spacious and well-appointed, nestled between towering coconut trees and tropical gardens.
sources.shortName: Where to Stay in El Nido, Palawan: 4 Best Areas

places.name: Nacpan Beach Glamping (H Hospitality Group)

reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful beach, crystal clear water.  The resort is well maintained, very clean, staff very welcoming, friendly. Wonderful service. We stayed in the tents and was wonderful to be on the beach. The tents are beautiful, very clean, AC, drinks provided. Shared facilities were very clean and well maintained. Just bring an eye mask and ear plugs as it gets very bright early and music is loud from nearby hotels and at the breakfast restaurant in the morning. As wonderful time we had, sleeping in a tent on the ground is something we likely would never do again. Lol

Nacpan Beach Glamping is the best! The beach is absolutely beautiful, and swimming there feels amazing. They also have a swimming pool, and my friends and I really enjoyed it. The staff are incredibly kind and friendly. The food spots around are also great! Special shout-out to Miss Vanyah from the front desk - she's super nice and very accommodating - and to their front desk supervisor, Sir Marv, who was very attentive to all our needs! I'll definitely recommend Nacpan Beach Glamping to my family!

We had an incredible time at Nacpan Glamping. We didn't expect the actual place to be as stunning as it was, especially since the bumpy and muddy road leading to it felt challenging. It truly felt like a hidden paradise. The long journey was absolutely worth it. Nestled in nature with breathtaking views, the location made me feel completely relaxed and at peace.

Highly recommend Nacpan Glamping for anyone looking for a fantastic, family-friendly escape with great food, awesome amenities, and exceptional service!

places.generalDescription: Seven Commandos Beach is a stunning destination in El Nido, featuring serene white-sand shores, clear turquoise waters, and picturesque rock formations. The beach is surrounded by coconut trees and a massive limestone cliff, creating a postcard-perfect setting reminiscent of Moana's island. Accessible only by boat, it has become a popular stop for island hopping tours in the area. Legend has it that the beach was named after seven Japanese soldiers who sought refuge there after World War II.

sources.snippet: The beach is famous for its powdery white sand and swimming activities as part of Tour A, but sometimes it can get crowded during the daytime as this is usually the tour's first stop. Seven Commandos Beach is also the home of the luxurious Vellago Resort, and guests who dock here are welcome to visit the beachfront and their restaurant. It is also possible to explore it by renting a kayak from Corong Corong for only 100 PHP per hour.
sources.shortName: Discover Top Beaches in El Nido, Palawan (12 Beaches) ‚Äì Big Dream Boatman

sources.snippet: Nestled below the limestone cliffs and formations that El Nido is famous for is another secluded tropical paradise that made several jaws drop throughout the years. Yes, that‚Äôs Seven Commandos Beach for you. With its glorious scenery of crystalline turquoise waters, white sand beach, beautiful caves, and rock formations, there‚Äôs no wonder why tons of tourists visit this beach despite its isolation.
sources.shortName: 15 BEST BEACHES in PALAWAN (world-class islands and beaches)

sources.snippet: There‚Äôs an old myth surrounding the Seven Commandos Beach: due to a shipwreck, seven soldiers got lost at the sea. Looking for a temporary place, the soldiers found the Seven Commandos Beach. After residing in the place while repairing their ship, the soldiers carved the words ‚Äú7 commandos‚Äù in a large rock before sailing away.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Unspoiled Beaches in El Nido Palawan

sources.snippet: Unlike common assumption, there is nothing militaristic about the island to where the Seven Commando Beach is located‚Äîthe name actually came from a carving on a stone as left behind by a group of people who were said to have been left stranded in the island resulting from a broken fishing vessel until it got fixed.
sources.shortName: 18 Must-See Beaches in El Nido, Palawan

sources.snippet: This was actually our final stop on the tour and it‚Äôs bloody awesome!. It‚Äôs a beautiful beach that has great snorkeling spots, places to relax, a volleyball net and of course stands selling beer and rum. Since it was our last spot we enjoyed a few rum and coke with our new friends we made on this awesome tour.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Things To Do In El Nido [Philippines] In 2024

sources.snippet: Seven Commandos Beach is yet another one of our favourite beaches in El Nido, still on the mainland but only accessible by sea. The short strip of glistening white sand is separated into a local area and a small resort tucked into the trees and rocks at the other end.
sources.shortName: 9 BEST BEACHES IN EL NIDO (2023)

sources.snippet: On my recent adventure to Palawan beach el nido, Seven Commandos Beach quickly became a favorite spot. Its name is mysterious, echoed tales of shipwrecks. The beach is easy to enjoy with its white sands and clear waters.

places.name: Seven Commandos Beach

reviews.text: Seven Commando Beach is a great spot to unwind while in El Nido. It has soft white sand, clear blue water, and a peaceful atmosphere that's perfect for swimming or just relaxing. There's even a small sari-sari store on the beach where you can grab drinks or snacks, which is super convenient. It's a nice stop during an island-hopping tour and definitely worth visiting!

This beach has been chosen as one of the most beautiful beaches in the world a few times. The beach is extended, and  there are some basic amenities for tourists. Consider that many tours bring people here and it can get very crowded. Nonetheless, that would not deter you from appreciating the beauty of the beach.

We visited this beach as a part of tour A.

It's just beautiful and snorkeling here is also great. I saw a squid, a lion fish (for the first time) and other fishes. The water is clear and the beach is beautiful ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•

places.generalDescription: Papaya Beach is a stunning destination in El Nido, Palawan, offering breathtaking views of the island and a vast sandy expanse. While it can get busy with tourists during the day, the crowds tend to thin out as sunset approaches, providing a more serene experience. The beach features fine white sand and lush rainforest surroundings, making it an ideal spot for relaxation and enjoying nature's beauty. Visitors can also find amenities such as a bar and restroom facilities for added convenience.

sources.snippet: Papaya Beach makes you feel like you‚Äôre lost in a tropical heaven. Nestled with sparkly fine sands, clear azure waters and towering cliffs and limestone karsts, this place makes you never want to leave. A truly beautiful island, Papaya Beach is a popular destination for people who want to loosen up and explore its waters.
sources.shortName: The 12 Most Beautiful Unspoiled Islands of El Nido

sources.snippet: Papaya Beach is located right next to Seven Commandos Beach and is separated from it by a thick rock. Since it was quite crowded at Seven Commandos Beach we paddled directly to Papaya Beach and had a little break. The beach, the sea and the view were really beautiful here which makes it one of the best beaches in El Nido.
sources.shortName: The 9 Best Beaches Of El Nido I Palawan

sources.snippet: Papaya Beach is a busy but beautiful beach that is a frequent stop on El Nido boat tours. It has a bar as well as restroom facilities where you can hang out and relax before continuing on your island-hopping adventure. Personally, I am not the biggest fan of Papaya Beach, because I got stung by a jellyfish there!
sources.shortName: 9 Best Beaches in El Nido: Where to Catch Sun & Sand in Palawan

sources.snippet: Adjacent to Seven Commando Beach, Papaya Beach is often devoid of crowds, especially in the afternoon. Therefore, I prefer kayaking to reach this beach and stay for an extended time. As a part of the Tour B itinerary, Papaya Beach is an excellent spot for beach lazing and swimming in its crystal-clear waters.

sources.snippet: Finding fishes the likes of Nemo does not need to get far if you are to snorkel Papaya Beach‚Äôs waters. The fishes‚Äô reeves are literally just a few feet away from the shore‚Äîa perfect setting for the young ones to enjoy their snorkeling without the need to worry of getting too far into the waters.
sources.shortName: 18 Must-See Beaches in El Nido, Palawan

sources.snippet: You can‚Äôt go all the way to Seven Commandos Beach without making a detour to Papaya Beach right around the corner. A limestone cliff separates these two beaches, and where Seven Commandos Beach is developed, Papaya Beach is raw and rugged.
sources.shortName: 9 BEST BEACHES IN EL NIDO (2023)

sources.snippet: At Papaya Beach, the reefs are literally a few feet away from the seashore. It is the perfect place for children or kids at heart who enjoy snorkeling without worrying about going too far from the shore.

sources.shortName: 10 best beaches in El Nido

places.name: Papaya Beach

reviews.text: One of my favorite beaches in El Nido. I would highly recommend you rent a kayak and visit at your own pace! We spent a whole day here relaxing. During that time you'll see boats tours come and go, but I feel like those on the boat tours do not get to enjoy it as much.

We were here on 27th of December 2024. Beautiful fine sand, water was perfect - not too hot or too cold. A nice surprise for us was that there were lots of butterflies on these flowering trees. In the water that's not too deep, we even saw many clownfish. I was very happy as I'm not a good swimmer and still panic in deep water even with life jacket on. But here, I could snorkel for a long time in relatively shallow water with lots of sea life to see. The water was quite calm as well so it's a good place for beginners to snorkel. We hired kayak for 600php from Corong-corong beach (no time limit) so you can take your time here in Papaya beach, Lapus lapus beach and Seven commando beach. The only downside at Papaya beach was that there were lots of small jellyfish so I felt a small sting here and there but no harm done.

Another great beach to kayak to from Coring Corong beach. It can be a bit choppy if the wind is up. But their is a vendor on the beach that sells cold drinks and snacks.
The snorkelling is fantastic  nice corals,fish and turtles. Lots of shade and silica white sand with a dramatic cliff and rainforest backdrop. Highly recommend visiting this beach!

places.generalDescription: Nestled behind a small cave, the Secret Lagoon is a popular spot for tourists seeking an adventure. It can be accessed through various island hopping tours that also cover other attractions in El Nido. Upon reaching the lagoon, visitors are greeted by stunning turquoise waters surrounded by towering limestone walls. The secluded ambiance adds to the allure of this hidden gem, offering a peaceful escape from the bustling tourist spots.

sources.snippet: I believe the area next to the secret lagoon is nicer than the Secret Lagoon itself, BUT, if you‚Äôve never been to a secret lagoon before, then you‚Äôll find it cute. You have to ‚Äúqueue‚Äù to get through the little rock into the secret lagoon. Be aware the water is filled with little stinging jellyfish.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Things To Do In El Nido [Philippines] In 2024

sources.snippet: If like us, you don‚Äôt have enough time (or budget!) to do all four tours, choosing which tour to take can be tricky. We chose tour A because we didn‚Äôt want to miss secret lagoon of El Nido Palawan and snorkelling. We chose tour B because Snake Island looked incredible.
sources.shortName: El Nido Palawan Beach Heaven

sources.snippet: Secret Lagoon is literally one of Miniloc Island‚Äôs best-kept secrets as it is hidden by massive karst cliffs. To get there, you‚Äôll crawl through a small hole to get through and once you‚Äôre inside, you‚Äôll discover the stunning Secret Lagoon‚Äôs cool, blue waters.
sources.shortName: best el nido resorts Archives

places.name: Secret Lagoon

reviews.text: It was such a unique and memorable experience entering the Secret Lagoon! We had to free dive through a narrow cave to reach the hidden waters. The view was really beautiful!

üåä Secret Lagoon, El Nido ‚Äì A Hidden Gem with a Bit of a Challenge

Our visit to the Secret Lagoon was truly unforgettable, though getting there wasn't easy. During our trip, the tide was high and the waves were quite strong, making the entrance a bit tricky. You have to kneel or crouch down to squeeze through the narrow opening, and I even got a small wound on my knees along the way.

Once inside, the lagoon itself was smaller than expected, and there wasn't much space to stand , probably because of the tide at the time. But despite the challenging entry, the experience was still magical. The hidden beauty of the place, surrounded by towering limestone cliffs, made it all worth it.

It's a raw, natural adventure, not the most comfortable, but definitely memorable. Just be prepared and wear proper footwear!

We were very fortunate to enter the secret lagoon when it was empty and really loved it. You have to enter it through a small hole in the rocks. Best to wear water shoes.
There was a quaint beach which was fun to hang out in. There was a very cute cat who was a major attraction!
This is a part of the Tour A

places.generalDescription: Miniloc Island is a stunning destination with lush rainforests, pristine white-sand beaches, and a diverse marine ecosystem. Recently recognized as the world's favorite island, it offers an unparalleled coastal village experience at El Nido Resorts. The island is renowned for its rich marine wildlife and vibrant coral reefs, making it ideal for snorkeling and diving enthusiasts. Visitors can explore popular attractions such as the Big and Small Lagoons, Snake Island, and more through private tours.

sources.snippet: With two lagoons at close proximity to one another somewhere around the Miniloc Island Resort, both Small Lagoon and Big Lagoon are ideal for snorkeling. Be warned, however, that certain fishes and sea urchins can be hostile in these places‚Äîbut, luckily, not strong enough to cause any serious injury or fatality to anyone.

sources.snippet: Checking in El Nido Resorts Miniloc Island will give you access to the beautiful Miniloc and other parts of Entalula Island. Like Lagen Island, this island has abundant coconut trees and limestone towers. Its waters are perfect for boating, swimming, and snorkeling.

places.generalDescription: Marimegmeg Beach, also known as Las Cabanas Beach, is a stunning destination in El Nido offering palm-fringed golden sands and beach shack bars with breathtaking sunset vistas. The area provides plenty of accommodation options, from luxurious resorts to budget-friendly hostels in different neighborhoods like Caalan Beach, El Nido Town, Corong Corong Beach, and Marimegmeg for nightlife.

sources.snippet: Blessed with a white sand beach, deep blue waters, and breathtaking scenery, Marimegmeg Beach is a popular destination for tourists that are seeking peace and tranquility. The waters are calm most of the time so chilling out at the beach or having long walks would be no problem here. The beach is famous for its zipline that gives you a glimpse of the unmatched beauty of El Nido.
sources.shortName: 15 BEST BEACHES in PALAWAN (world-class islands and beaches)

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs part of the mainland but is not too crowded compared to its neighboring beaches. Unlike the other beaches on this list, Marimegmeg Beach is not too blessed with limestone cliffs, but you can find shade here in the resorts in the area. Still, getting a healthy dose of orange sunset sun rays on Marimegmeg‚Äôs beach is also a good option.
sources.shortName: Ultimate List of Amazing Islands and Beaches in El Nido Palawan

sources.snippet: It may look pretty average in the photo, but it was raining while we were there; I‚Äôm sure it looks a lot better when the sun is out. places.name: Marimegmeg Beach

reviews.text:
Mareme Gmeg Bleach beach is a dreamy spot, a hidden paradise far from the crowds, where nature unfolds in all its splendor. The fine golden sand blends with vibrant turquoise waters, creating a scene worthy of a postcard.

From a comfortable hammock, with your feet buried in the sand and the waves gently lapping your ankles, the spectacle is unparalleled. The view opens onto a horizon dotted with islands, their silhouettes seemingly delicately painted against the endless blue of the ocean. The sea breeze caresses your skin, and the rhythmic sound of the waves completes the symphony of this natural refuge.

Unlike other crowded beaches, tranquility reigns here. The towering trees that reach the shore offer generous shade, inviting rest and contemplation.  The walk along the beach to Caba√±as Bleach is a true delight: the swaying of the palm trees, the birdsong, and the sensation of walking on soft sand make the walk an almost magical experience.

To enjoy this paradise even more, there's nothing better than relaxing at the beach bar and restaurant, where you can rent sun loungers and enjoy a refreshing drink or a delicious meal. The place is magnificent, with a welcoming atmosphere and impeccable service. The waiters, always friendly and professional, make each visit an even more pleasant experience, especially Rafael, Mark, Kristel, Raymond, whose attentiveness and warmth leave a lasting impression on every visitor.

As evening falls, the sunset unfolds its magic. The sky is tinged with shades of gold, orange, and pink, reflecting off the water like a moving canvas. It's a spectacle worth enjoying slowly, allowing every nuance and reflection to be etched in your memory.

For the more adventurous, the zip line offers a unique perspective. Gliding over the beach and admiring the immensity of the landscape from above is an exciting and unforgettable experience. From the air, the beauty of this paradise is revealed in all its splendor, with the beach stretching out like a golden tapestry and the turquoise waters shimmering in the sun.

Mareme Gmeg Bleach is not just a beach; it's a destination for the senses, a gift from nature that invites you to unwind, explore, and, above all, enjoy beauty in its purest form.

Clean fine sands beach not the best but ok and as you walk towards Las Cabanas beach where the zip lining is, more rocks and corals.
Can get very crowded after noon time.
Note: Signs of warning for box jellyfish and sea urchins can been seen.

Love love love this beach but only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because there isn't any rubbish bins anywhere. Even when you walk through the shops from the main road there's nothing around to dispose your rubbish, soon this will become a huge issue as tourism grows and grows.

places.generalDescription: Shimizu Island is a small island in El Nido, known for its sandy beaches and clear waters that are perfect for snorkeling. The island got its name from a Japanese diver who died while diving in the underwater tunnel there. Although the tunnel is no longer accessible, the island's seawaters are still great for diving and swimming.

sources.snippet: To know why the island is named a la Japanese is to know the history that took place in the area. It‚Äôs not about World War II, but there is a significant event that took place in the island meriting it a Japanese name‚Äîa Japanese diver by the name ‚ÄúShimizu‚Äù died while diving in the island‚Äôs underwater tunnel. While the tunnel itself is no longer accessible, the island‚Äôs seawaters are still good for diving and swimming around.

sources.snippet: Just south of Miniloc Island from #10 is Simizu Island, a beach with towering limestone cliffs and white sands. The area of the island with sand is not very large, and the limestone in the backdrop gives shade to the island for the most part of the day. But that‚Äôs okay because, on Shimizu Island, snorkeling is the number one beach activity.

places.name: Shimizu Island

reviews.text:
Visiting this island was an absolute dream! The water was crystal clear, and the fine white sand felt like walking on clouds. Snorkeling here was incredible; I saw a vibrant array of fish and stunning coral formations. I highly recommend this destination for anyone seeking a tropical paradise experience.

For the best exploration, I suggest trying the El Nido Tour A. It's definitely worth it, offering unforgettable sights and experiences. Don't miss out on this gem when planning your trip!

Disclaimer: All photos belong to me and Why Go Philippines.

Trivia: Shimizu is a Japanese word for pure water.

places.generalDescription: El Nido Beach, also known as "The Nest," is a stunning destination in the northernmost tip of mainland Palawan. It serves as the gateway to the Bacuit archipelago, featuring white-sand beaches and coral reefs. The area includes 45 islands and islets with unique geological formations. While El Nido Town itself may not offer many activities, it boasts numerous restaurants and beach bars along the main beach where visitors can soak up the vibrant atmosphere.

sources.snippet: It might not be the most picturesque beach in El Nido, but the main beach in town is definitely a place you should visit at least once. You‚Äôll likely go here to board your boat for island hopping, but spend a little time walking along the shore and talking to the locals.

places.name: El Nido Beach

reviews.text:
In my opinion, El Nido is one of the prettiest towns. We were there for scuba diving. We stayed in town to have easy access to the dive centre, shops, restaurants, and the beach. We liked the beach very much. See the first photos. When the island hopping boats are gone, the beach is very quiet. Swimming is easy there. One must be careful when swimming if the boats are returning, but it's generally okay. The boats approach the shore carefully, disembark the guests, and immediately leave.
There are lots of other beaches around which are accessible from land or via island hopping tours. They are all beautiful. I must say I was pretty impressed with the El Nido beach. In the evenings, after dinner, it was nice to walk on the beach.
Full sunset, however, isn't observable from the beach due to the hill there. But no worries, nearby beach which everyone goes is great to enjoy the sunset.

These are not pictures of El Nido beach but of the tours, which are great.  The beach is swimmable once the boats leave and before they come back.  But a great area to find a cafe or bar overlooking the area for people watching.
So far so good, I haven't been for a swim yet, but maybe I'll go this week. Nice stretch of sand to walk along, a few bars and restaurants along the way.

places.generalDescription: Entalula Beach is a stunning stretch of powdery white sand shaded by towering mountains, making it one of the most picturesque beaches in El Nido. The beach offers relaxing shallow waters and a peaceful atmosphere, perfect for sun worshippers looking to bask on the soft sand after taking a dip in the pure sapphire water.

sources.snippet: Entalula is a stunning beach that is frequently used by boat tours as a spot for lunch. It has great sun coverage with thick trees, and it even has a small shack where you can buy beer. It is a great place to hang out, sit in the water, and just catch a break from the sun.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Beaches in El Nido: Where to Catch Sun & Sand in Palawan

places.name: Entalula Beach

reviews.text: our last stop from Tour A. The guide recommended this instead of seven commandos beach due to the latter being too boring (nothing to do there). This beach has a small shop for drinks and some tables and benches. nice place to relax after a tiring day of island hopping. the sand is powdery white at the shore but has small rocks when you go to the waters.

Entalula Beach, located on Entalula Island in El Nido, Palawan, is consistently ranked among the top beaches in the world due to its stunning beauty and serene atmosphere. The beach features powdery white sand, crystal-clear turquoise waters, and dramatic limestone cliffs, making it a standout spot on the island-hopping circuit. Its shallow, calm waters are perfect for swimming and snorkeling, with vibrant coral reefs just off the shore.

What sets Entalula apart is its relatively uncrowded nature, despite being a popular stop on tours. A private resort exists on the island, but public areas remain undeveloped, preserving the beach's natural charm. From above, the aerial views are breathtaking, showcasing the perfect combination of sand, sea, and rock formations.

This beach is a true must-see. Its beauty is even more impressive in person, offering a level of tranquility and stunning scenery that's hard to match. If you're in El Nido, don't miss the chance to experience it firsthand.
This was our favorite stop. We came here twice, but during low and high tides. it's better during low tides so you can snorkel and see the corals

places.generalDescription: Duli Beach, located in the northern part of Palawan, is a serene and spacious beach that offers a variety of activities such as surfing and sunbathing. It is known for its stunning sunset views and is popular among the surfing community in El Nido. Accessible via a rough road, this hidden gem charges a modest entrance fee but provides a peaceful escape with gentle waves suitable for novice surfers. While there are nearby restaurants, it's recommended to bring your own food for convenience.

sources.snippet: El Nido's off-the-beaten-path surfing hotspot is about a half-hour drive from Nacpan Beach. However, the drive to Duli Beach can be difficult due to the dirt and dusty road conditions. This spot, however, is popular among local surfers and tourists looking to catch some waves, particularly during the best surfing season in November.
sources.shortName: Discover Top Beaches in El Nido, Palawan (12 Beaches) ‚Äì Big Dream Boatman

sources.snippet: Lio beach: One notable aspect of Lio Beach is its focus on sustainability and responsible tourism. The development aims to preserve the natural beauty of the area and support the local community. This makes it a great choice for travelers who are looking for a more eco-friendly and luxurious beach experience in the El Nido region.
sources.shortName: 10 best beaches in El Nido

sources.snippet: Not as crowded as Nacpan, Duli Beach is a bit more rustic and laid-back‚Äîexcept during surfing season (November and March) when surfers drive by and ride the waves!. Duli Beach has a wide sandbank too and stretches up to 2km. It has one bungalow accommodation, Duli Beach Resort, and a few shacks offering surfing lessons.
sources.siteName: Your Travel Guide and Online Booking to El Nido, Palawan, Philippines
sources.shortName: 10 El Nido Beaches for Your Next Motorbike Adventure

sources.snippet: Duli Beach is a hidden gem in El Nido that‚Äôs definitely worth the journey. This remote beach may not be the easiest to reach, but the experience of visiting this vast, uninhabited paradise is truly unforgettable. Duli features white sand lined with palm trees and clear waters that gently roll onto the shore.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in El Nido, Palawan

sources.snippet: The crystal clear waters roll onto the stretch of the white sands and palm trees. Duli Beach is also a haven for those looking for surfing spots in the Philippines. Known as a Surfer‚Äôs Paradise, there are a lot of big waves, especially during the rainy season.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Unspoiled Beaches in El Nido Palawan

sources.snippet: Duli Beach (located here) is not as popular as Nacpan Beach but it‚Äôs becoming more and more visited and liked by travelers. It‚Äôs also an ideal spot for amateur surfers. The North Swell is in fact a restaurant where you can book affordable surfing classes.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Places To Visit In El Nido In 2025

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs a long white sand beach with clear turquoise water and barely other people. There is only one small beach bar; the rest of the beach is remote and quiet. It‚Äôs the perfect beach to spend the day relaxing, reading a book, and swimming.
sources.shortName: 4 best beaches in El Nido

sources.snippet: Not many people are aware that there‚Äôs a surf beach in El Nido. If you visit Duli Beach at the right time of year, you‚Äôll likely be blessed with swell perfect for beginners as well as experienced surfers who want some fun, easy waves.
sources.shortName: 9 BEST BEACHES IN EL NIDO (2023)

sources.snippet: Duli Beach is an unknown 2-kilometer-long white beach in the far northern tip of El Nido, Palawan. There is a 50 PHP (1 USD) entrance fee to the beach. No time to read now?
sources.siteName: Salt in our Hair Travel Blog
sources.shortName: 10 Best Things To Do in El Nido, Palawan (2025 Travel Guide)

sources.shortName: 10 stunning El Nido beaches you can visit without a tour

sources.snippet: San Vicente receives far less visitors than El Nido ‚Äì which means you a greater chance of having this beautiful beach all to yourself.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Beaches in Palawan

places.name: Duli Beach

reviews.text: Gorgeous and massive beach. Road can be a bit rough for access. MAKE SURE YOU FOLLOW SIGNS as Google maps currently takes you to Station One the private (and expensive) resort, instead of the public access to the beach.

Beautiful beach, not crowded but also you won't be alone.
High waves, so great for surfing üèÑ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

With sand that's more brownish than white, Duli Beach still manages to attract quite a lot of people for surfing and the general relaxed lifestyle. It's a very picturesque, coconut tree-lined beach, offering a laid-back vibe.

Although most parts of the beach feel quite secluded, there's a pretty decent choice of bars and restaurants at the northern tip.

places.generalDescription: Lapus Lapus Beach is a hidden gem that promises an unforgettable experience for those seeking tranquility and natural beauty. Nestled near Corong Corong Beach, this stunning spot offers a serene atmosphere perfect for relaxation. Visitors can enjoy the picturesque views while lounging under trees or capturing memorable photos with the beach as a backdrop.

sources.snippet: Part of the beach is private property, so it‚Äôs best to stay to the right side. Here you can go ashore, unpack your beach towel under the tree and enjoy the great beach with the beautiful view. We spent our last day in El Nido here and especially discovered the tree as a great photo motif and took lots of pictures.
sources.shortName: The 9 Best Beaches Of El Nido I Palawan

sources.snippet: One of my favorite is Lapus Lapus beach which is located here. The only way you can get there is by kayaking from Corong Corong but you‚Äôll have to rent a kayak first!. Many hotels offer kayaks for rent for around 500 pesos per day, which is around $9.
sources.shortName: The Most Beautiful Places To Visit In El Nido In 2025

places.name: Lapus Lapus Beach

reviews.text: Well who would expect such great encounters at this quiet beach! Clownfish and a sea turtle were waiting for us underwater! Bring your snorkeling gear when visiting. Been there at the end of April

Beautiful beach and with only few people as outside of the main tours. We reached by kayak from Corong Corong, easy 15min paddling to get there. You can snorkel here but no shack or anyone to rent it, so better come equipped if you intend to spend more time here. Otherwise, another 15min paddling to get to Papaya beach where there is someone selling drinks.

*PLEASE BRING DOGFOOD*

On the beach are two dogs who are (if i read the past reviews of this place on google review) not fed or taken care of üò£. We brought some food (you can find dogfood at the Drugman or the petstore!!) which they ate within seconds. They where very hungry. They are the sweetest dogs ever so please lets make sure together that they get enough food!!!

IMPORTANT NOTE: When dogs are not used to eating a lot you could kill them by feeding to much as there stomach is to weak for that. It's better to feed them small portions every hour / 2 hour!!

places.generalDescription: Spin Designer Hostel is a laid-back accommodation option that offers private rooms and dorms, as well as a rooftop deck, BBQ facilities, and complimentary breakfast. Situated near Corong Corong Beach, the hostel provides a shared kitchen with barbecue amenities and a games room for entertainment. Guests can also enjoy a common terrace overlooking the lush forest. The hostel provides free toiletries, towels, and bed linens, while some rooms feature private bathrooms for added privacy.

sources.snippet: Spin Designer Hostel is another one of the best budget accommodations in El Nido. It‚Äôs located close to the hub of town proper, yet far enough away to escape the noise. This trendy property offers both private rooms and mixed and female dormitories.
sources.shortName: Where to Stay in El Nido, Palawan: 4 Best Areas
The Secret Beach of Matinloc Island: El Nido, Palawan, Philippines

places.name: Spin Designer Hostel

reviews.text: I only stayed one night in a private room, but I truly enjoyed my time here. The atmosphere is peaceful and laid-back, perfect if you're looking to unwind away from the noise, yet still close enough to reach the town center easily. The property is beautifully designed, with spacious common areas, a relaxing pool, and a welcoming vibe. I was greeted with a complimentary cocktail by the pool, which made for a lovely arrival. Everything felt clean and well maintained, and the staff were always kind and helpful. I would happily stay longer next time to enjoy the full experience, including the activities and social evenings they organize.

I had an amazing stay at Spin Design Hostel! From the moment I arrived, the team was warm, welcoming, and eager to help. They went above and beyond to make sure I had a comfortable and enjoyable stay. The room was okay, but it was the staff's friendly smiles and helpful nature that truly made my experience special. Whether I needed help with tour bookings, restaurant recommendations, or just a friendly chat, they were always happy to assist. If you're looking for a place with exceptional hospitality, Spin Design Hostel is the way to go!

Stayed here in Dorm 27 for 3 nights.

Arrived a 2 hours earlier than official check-in, but was asked to wait. It was lunchtime anyway, so I wasn't too bothered. The rooms was very spacious and could easily have fitted more than the four beds. The room had A/C and a ceiling fan, so it was really nice to be able to have a higher temperature on the A/C and use the fan to circulate air. Each bunk had a locker and the hostel even provided a lock. Each bunk had privacy curtains, a private light, a thin blanket and a towel. Check bunk also had a plenty of storage attached to the bunk if you didn't want to put stuff in the locker. There were plenty of sockets, but were located about half way up a wall, so it was harder to use if on the upper bunk. The mattress felt like they were extra wide than a single and were very comfortable. Another oddity is that the upper section of the walls have windows facing out into the hallway, which is lit at night. I had a sleep mask, so I was less bothered.

There was I think one shared bathroom with 5 toilets and 4 showers. The toilers were generally clean, but the number of people using them meant that they should've been cleaned more often. The showers were fine except that 3 had broken soap/shampoo dispensers and always filled.

Breakfast was provided and the options were a cut above the standard offered in other hostels. The staff even make pancakes and omelettes fresh. Fresh fruits, toasts, tea, juice and coffees are also available.

Location wise, the hostel is located about 5 minutes walk from from the main centre, but that's fine for me as I prefer to be away from the noise.

Overall, I had an excellent stay. The staff are magnificent and provide impeccable service. The design and services offered by the hostel is a cut above. However, the aforementioned annoyances meant I dinged one star.

places.address: Balinsasayaw Road, cor Calle Real, El Nido, 5313 Palawan, Philippines

places.generalDescription: When visiting El Nido, make sure to include a stop at the Secret Beach in your itinerary. This hidden gem is nestled within towering karst cliffs and can only be accessed through a small opening that requires visitors to swim through it. The beach offers a tropical paradise experience with its powdery white shoreline and glistening waters. It's part of the Tour C package, which also includes other attractions like Helicopter Island and Matinloc Shrine.

sources.snippet: Rent a kayak and explore secret beaches around Cadlao island. The island across town has stunning wildlife like monkeys, big lizards, and hornbill birds. For a unique experience, rent a clear kayak in El Nido.
sources.siteName: Salt in our Hair Travel Blog
sources.shortName: 10 Best Things To Do in El Nido, Palawan (2025 Travel Guide)

places.name: Secret Beach

reviews.text: Well worth the visit and amazing once inside the beach area.

Last destination of Tour C.
You have to swim for quite some distance to reach this place. Since we arrived late in the afternoon, waves were bigger which made the swimming more challenging but it's all worth it.

Secret Beach is the first stop of Tour C. This is one of four tour packages offered in El Nido, Palawan. The price varies depending on the travel agency or hotel packages. Our group bought hotel stay for 4 nights, van transportation to and fro Puerto Princesa, as well as Tour A and C all for the low and reasonable price of 5250 pesos per head.

To access this beach, you got to swim from the boat and enter a relatively small hole. The view underwater is absolutely stunning! I enjoyed snorkeling outside the beach and near the entrance since the beach does not have many fishes. This is a must try for marine life enthusiasts! Definitely a good adventure to try.

places.generalDescription: Outpost Beach Hostel is a lively and vibrant beachfront accommodation located in Corong-Corong, just a short tricycle ride away from El Nido town. The hostel offers both dorms and private rooms, as well as a terrace restaurant and bar overlooking the beach and sea. With nightly themed activities, social gatherings, and breathtaking sunset views, it's an ideal spot for young and sociable travelers.

sources.snippet: For those wondering where to stay in El Nido for great sunsets at a good price, Outpost Beach Hostel is your best bet. This fun and social hostel offers both private rooms and dormitory-style accommodations equipped with air-conditioning units and fans. They make for a comfortable base for your island-hopping adventures.
sources.shortName: Where to Stay in El Nido, Palawan: 4 Best Areas

places.name: Outpost Beach Hostel

reviews.text: We stayed here on our trip to El Nido. The rooms are very clean and tidy and have a load of space. The only thing I can complain about is that the WiFi wasn't the best in our room but I believe that'll depend on the room you stay in (we were quite far out). The toilets and showered are shared but there are plenty of them. We ate lunch and dinner here. We had the chicken sandwich as well as the chicken rice bowl and margarita pizza and it was delicious! The rice bowl did say boneless chicken thigh and it did come on the bone but I was okay with that, there was still plenty of meat there. The prices were very reasonably for the quality too! The staff were super friendly and attentive. The location is a little far out from El Nido town however the tricycles take you down to town for only 100 pesos making it bearable. The hostel itself is gorgeous with a lovely view of the sunset. Would definitely recommend staying here when coming to El Nido!üåÖüçîüçï

My absolute favorite hostel! The location is perfect, just a bit outside the center (only 6 minutes) so it's much quieter, and the views are insane, way better than being right in town. The staff is EXCEPTIONAL: super welcoming, always helpful, funny, and they create such a good vibe. Also as a solo traveler it was so easy to make friends there! The hostel itself is awesome, with great rooms and showers. Nothing to complain about, it was honestly more than perfect! The atmosphere is great, and the food at the restaurant is also delicious (especially the banana shake).

My fianc√© and I had a wonderful time at El Nido Outpost Hostel-we were greeted with warmth and care the moment we arrived. We stayed for a week, and somehow, each day topped the last.

The highlight for me was without a doubt the staff. Every single person working there goes above and beyond to make the space feel like home. You can tell they genuinely care and take pride in creating a welcoming, fun, and supportive atmosphere. It felt less like a hostel and more like a vibrant little community.

The views are unmatched-watching the sunset every evening with a cold (and affordable!) drink in hand, surrounded by new friends, was something we'll never forget. The nightly events and activities were all super well thought-out and an absolute blast. Whether you're traveling solo or as a couple, it's such an easy place to meet people and make memories.

We're already dreaming of coming back. Couldn't recommend Outpost enough-if you're heading to El Nido, this is where you want to stay. The people truly make the place, and they made our trip unforgettable.

places.address: Outpost Beach Hostel Sitio Lugadia BRGY, El Nido, 5313 Palawan, Philippines

places.generalDescription: Island in Philippines famous for its sandy beaches and crystal clear waters. The island is a private property, but guests are welcome to explore the beach and reef on foot.

sources.snippet: Two kilometers southwest of the picturesque Entalula Island is Pangalusian Island, another picturesque beach island in El Nido, Palawan. It‚Äôs one of the most recently developed beaches on this list but private property. The island is mostly just a massive chunk of rock, but, as if nature decided it would make a perfect beach, there is also a tiny pocket of cream-colored sands where a resort lies.
sources.shortName: Ultimate List of Amazing Islands and Beaches in El Nido Palawan

places.name: Pangalusian Island

reviews.text:
Had an amazing experience! PIR sets the bar high when it comes to resorts. It's one thing to have a beautiful environment but another thing to deliver topnotch service. The beach, the marine life, the beachfront villas and the amazing weather all did their job - but the experience comes in full circle with great customer service from airport pickup, to room transfer, to food delivery, and everything else.

Shout-out to the amazing staff of PIR. Well done!!!

Absolutely loved this Island. My husband and I went here after a few days in miniloc island and couldn't be any happier about how comfortable and beautiful our room and view was. There are several activities by boat and snorkeling right on the island which we really loved. I Highly recommend staying here

A once in a lifetime class experience. Walk 65 yds to your beach, pull on swim fins, mask and snorkel, start swimming immediately in warm water and most impressive array of coral and brilliant tropical fish of every color! Paradise!
Morning buffet was not up to standards. Monkeys need to be brought under control...they will enter your room even if you're in there and rob the cookie jar....could be a risk.

places.generalDescription: Helicopter Island, also known as Dilumacad, is a captivating destination in Bacuit Bay, El Nido. The island boasts lush limestone hills and unspoiled beaches that make it a must-see stop on island hopping tours. Its dramatic cliffs and verdant foliage are characteristic of the area's natural beauty. Visitors can enjoy the unique rock formations that give the island its name, resembling a helicopter from afar.

sources.snippet: If like us, you don‚Äôt have enough time (or budget!) to do all four tours, choosing which tour to take can be tricky. We chose tour A because we didn‚Äôt want to miss secret lagoon of El Nido Palawan and snorkelling. We chose tour B because Snake Island looked incredible.
sources.shortName: El Nido Palawan Beach Heaven

sources.snippet: Dilumacad Island is also called Helicopter Island because it looks like a helicopter from a distance. This beach is amazing for snorkeling. You can already see a wide variety of fishes and reefs just by snorkeling in the shallow end, body-deep.
sources.shortName: 5 Beautiful Islands and Beaches in El Nido, Palawan

sources.snippet: Be fascinated by hidden white sandy beaches, breathtaking rock formations and beautiful lagoons with crystal clear waters on the El Nido Hidden Beaches and Island Hopping Tour.
sources.shortName: El Nido Hidden Beaches & Island Hopping

sources.snippet: Helicopter island is famous for its beauty and unique shape. It boasts towering limestone cliffs, great snorkelling, lush vegetation and amazing beaches.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Things To Do In El Nido [Philippines] In 2024

places.name: Helicopter Island

reviews.text: Beautiful island! A lot of activities there. I accidentally left a pair of Flipper slippers there. If anyone found it, please let me know. üôè
White sand beach, but in water is big rocks, so swimming with waves can be difficult. Also someone lives in that beach. No toilet!
Fine, white sand beach, peaceful and serene. One of the stops of Tour C. Perfect place for swimming but not for lunch buffet/boodle flight since shaded areas are fewer.

places.generalDescription: Talisay Beach is a stunning stop on Tour C in El Nido, located on Matinloc Island. It offers a picturesque setting for a picnic lunch and snorkeling experience in the turquoise waters. The beach provides exclusivity as each tour group has different itineraries, making it possible to enjoy the beauty of the beach with minimal crowds. Additionally, visitors can look forward to visiting the Secret Beach, accessible only through a small opening that requires swimming through.

sources.snippet: Fifteen minutes earlier, the Poor Traveler and his six poor friends were feeling a little bit sleepy after our big, satisfying lunch at Talisay beach. Our boat was smoothly breaking the waves towards another white beach and the sound of the engine roaring and the waves slapping the side of the boat were creating a melody that was relaxing, hypnotic, almost sedating.
sources.shortName: The Secret Beach of Matinloc Island: El Nido, Palawan, Philippines

sources.snippet: One of the highlights in El Nido Tour C is the Talisay Beach, located in Matinloc Island. Though short, the beach gives a feeling of exclusivity. Each boatmen and its tourist have different itinerary on a daily basis so there is a great chance that your group will be the only ones enjoying Talisay beach.
sources.shortName: 18 Must-See Beaches in El Nido, Palawan

sources.snippet: Talisay Beach: Located on Miniloc Island, Talisay Beach offers great opportunities for snorkeling and swimming, surrounded by towering limestone formations.
sources.shortName: 10 best beaches in El Nido

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs got beautiful white sand and blue waters perfect for swimming and snorkelling. Cost: 1300, again, cheaper to book online.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Things To Do In El Nido [Philippines] In 2024

places.name: Talisay Beach

reviews.text: We arrived here during lunchtime because the island serves as the Lunch area for Tour C island hopping. Upon docking to the island I am amazed how clear the water is.. I would love to explore the island however due to intense heat of the sun I didn't got the chance to roam the area..

Nice and protected from wind and swell. Decent snorkeling area and lunch spot. When the tide is high it gets a bit crowded with no room for people to sit on the beach. Gorgeous area with unreal backdrop.
Amazing natural beauty and wildlife here. Canoeing, swimming, snorkeling and walking trails are available here.

places.generalDescription: The Small Lagoon and Big Lagoon in Bacuit Bay, specifically located in Miniloc Island, El Nido, are breathtaking natural wonders surrounded by towering limestone cliffs. The azure waters of the lagoons contrast beautifully with the dark cliffs, creating a mesmerizing sight. These lagoons were once caves whose roofs collapsed to form the stunning enclosed bodies of water.

sources.snippet: With two lagoons at close proximity to one another somewhere around the Miniloc Island Resort, both Small Lagoon and Big Lagoon are ideal for snorkeling. Be warned, however, that certain fishes and sea urchins can be hostile in these places‚Äîbut, luckily, not strong enough to cause any serious injury or fatality to anyone.
sources.shortName: 18 Must-See Beaches in El Nido, Palawan

sources.snippet: The Big and Small Lagoons are two of the most popular and must-visit attractions in El Nido. Both lagoons are surrounded by limestone cliffs and boast waters so clear that you can even see some fish and corals. To fully enjoy these places, rent a kayak and paddle along the surface.
sources.shortName: best el nido resorts Archives

places.name: Small Lagoon to Big Lagoon

reviews.text:
Beautiful natural salt water lagoon. The entrance is via a very small nook in the stone wall, only accesible via kayak or swiming. Might get crowded but is still very enjoyable.
Most hotels offer excursions to this place. El Nido Miniloc Hotel also offers a joint excursion to a propietary beach for snorkeling close by with very vast corals and sealife easely accesible.

Better than big lagoon for me üòç

Insta : @carinowanderers

Small lagoon is arguably more picturesque than large lagoon; but the downside to that is that you'll have to be patient with all the kayaks to get an unobstructed view of the lagoon and cliffs.  Still a worthy destination, though.

places.generalDescription: Panorama Beach Club & Boutique Hotel El Nido lives up to its name by offering stunning panoramic views of El Nido's natural beauty. Situated in the heart of Bacuit Bay, it provides easy access to the famous Big Lagoon and boasts its own beach area with pristine waters and white sands. The hotel offers 8 elegant rooms equipped with premium amenities for a comfortable stay. Guests can enjoy free Wi-Fi, airport transportation arrangements, and complimentary parking.

sources.snippet: Panorama is a boutique resort set between Corong Corong and Maremigmeg Beach. This aesthetic property features thatched roof cottages and lush tropical gardens. I love the floor-to-ceiling windows and hand-crafted furnishings in their deluxe suites.
sources.shortName: Where to Stay in El Nido, Palawan: 4 Best Areas

places.name: Panorama Boutique hotel & Beach Club

reviews.text: Christian, Pauline and the rest of the workers there know how to entertain and provide the best service. Drinks are amazing and so are the food options, and the view is breathtaking. We came here for multiple days and were taken care off very well. I'll be back for the fabulous staff, food and drinks and spectacular views!

A Hidden Gem in El Nido ‚Äì Panorama Beach Club is Paradise!

We had an absolutely unforgettable experience at Panorama Beach Club in El Nido, Palawan! From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with genuine warmth and hospitality that made us feel like we were right at home-only with a view of paradise!

The beach club itself is stunning, with a laid-back yet chic vibe that's perfect for relaxing with friends or enjoying a romantic sunset. The views of Bacuit Bay are breathtaking, especially as the sun dips below the horizon-truly one of the best spots to catch the sunset in El Nido.

The drinks were top-notch-creative, refreshing, and perfectly crafted. We especially loved sipping on cocktails by the beach while soaking in the relaxed atmosphere and groovy tunes. The paella was a highlight of our visit-flavorful, hearty, and clearly inspired by authentic Spanish recipes. It was the perfect dish to share and paired beautifully with their house sangria.

But what truly made our experience stand out was the incredible staff. Every team member was friendly and attentive, but a special shoutout goes to Ed, who went above and beyond to ensure we felt welcome and well taken care of. His warmth, charisma, and attention to detail really made the experience feel like home away from home.

If you're in El Nido and looking for a place that combines stunning views, great food and drinks, and amazing hospitality, Panorama Beach Club is an absolute must-visit.

This time, I visited Panorama Beach Bar during the low season. I've been coming to El Nido since 2010 and have been there more than 40 times. The day before, we were also at Panorama, and there were only 3 other guests in total. We had some drinks and snacks and were lying on the front row of sunbeds.

Today, we decided to go back to Panorama. When we arrived, there were 7 crew members just hanging around because there was absolutely nothing to do. We were planning to have a nice dinner and some drinks, and I walked over to the sunbeds, not knowing what scene would unfold later.

The crew immediately approached me to say that their supervisor had instructed them it was not allowed for us to use the sunbeds without paying for them. The day before, they had let it slide (I had no idea there was even a charge), but now I really had to pay.

If it were high season, I'd understand, but during low season - when we were literally the only guests that afternoon - I would be happy if a customer wanted to spend money on food and drinks at the club. And let's be honest, it all looks nice, but it's obviously not Ushua√Øa in Ibiza, where I'd happily drop a few thousand euros on a VIP table.

Naturally, we left immediately without spending a single peso.

Advice to Panorama: try to appreciate the few guests you get during the off-season.

places.address: Taytay - El Nido National Hwy, El Nido, Palawan, Philippines

places.generalDescription: Nestled amidst towering limestone cliffs and accessible only by boat, Secret Beach is a hidden gem frequented by tour boats. Snorkeling enthusiasts will revel in the underwater wonders of this secluded spot. Accommodation options abound, catering to various preferences and budgets in different neighborhoods like Caalan Beach, El Nido Town, Corong Corong Beach, Marimegmeg, and Nacpan. The local dining scene offers a diverse range of culinary experiences from seafood to vegan dishes.

sources.snippet: When your boat arrives, you will be greeted by a massive limestone wall, and you may wonder how to unveil the "Secret". However, the elusive Secret Beach lies beyond this natural barrier, accessible only through a small hole in the rock formation. Depending on the tide, the hole may be visible or completely hidden, requiring a swim of less than a meter to pass through.
sources.shortName: Discover Top Beaches in El Nido, Palawan (12 Beaches) ‚Äì Big Dream Boatman

sources.snippet: El Nido‚Äôs Secret Beach makes you feel like you‚Äôre spending time in your very own beachfront. This secluded area offers so many picture opportunities. It is surrounded by sensational rock formations that conceals the beach but at the same time, still offering amazing panoramic views.

sources.snippet: If you are planning to visit Coron, you will realize that the Secret Beach is very similar to the Twin Lagoon in Coron. This dazzling beach is completely surrounded by limestone cliffs. It is only accessible by a small opening through the cliffs that you have to swim through.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Beaches in El Nido: Where to Catch Sun & Sand in Palawan

sources.snippet: If like us, you don‚Äôt have enough time (or budget!) to do all four tours, choosing which tour to take can be tricky. We chose tour A because we didn‚Äôt want to miss secret lagoon of El Nido Palawan and snorkelling. We chose tour B because Snake Island looked incredible.
sources.shortName: El Nido Palawan Beach Heaven

sources.snippet: Secret beach can only be accessed via swimming through a keyhole, which makes it a true secret. It‚Äôs very small too, but ever so beautiful. The author of the famous ‚ÄúThe Beach‚Äù movie wrote this book in El Nido, so it was probably inspired by this beach.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Things To Do In El Nido [Philippines] In 2024

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre feeling adventurous, consider visiting the Secret Beach. Now this one is really true to its name because it is concealed by the cliffs. For you to see the Secret Beach, you have to swim through a crevice.
sources.shortName: best el nido resorts Archives

sources.snippet: Visiting Secret Beach in Palawan holds a charm quite unlike any other. It‚Äôs an experience waiting to unfold. Just when I thought I‚Äôd seen the best of El Nido, this secluded paradise completely surprised me.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in El Nido Palawan Philippines

sources.snippet: Secret Beach: Accessible by boat and often included in island-hopping tours, Secret Beach is surrounded by towering limestone cliffs and offers a secluded and tranquil experience.
sources.shortName: 10 best beaches in El Nido

places.name: Secret Beach

reviews.text: This is another gem of the El Nido tour C. The rock formations and beaches are so cool. Our tourguide hurried us here, because he mentioned if the high tide comes, we can't get in or get out of this beach.

The beach is amazing, with stunning views of rocks, greenery, and absolutely beautiful water. Consider that since many people come here, the beach can get crowded. However, it would not minimise your appreciation of the setting.

On all 4 island hopping tours this for me was a standout, way better than secret lagoon and up there with small and big lagoons.

There is another secret part of secret beach where you can swim under some rocks and end up in a small 1m¬≤ chamber, a dome like structure that has sunlight coming in the top.

Not everyone can fit, but if you can go spend a minute in there and just relax, it was brilliant.

places.generalDescription: Shimizu Island is a part of the popular El Nido Island Hopping tours in El Nido, Philippines. It is included in several tour packages such as Tour B, Tour C, and Tour D. These tours offer visits to various attractions including Snake Island, Cudugnon Cave, Popolcan Island, Secret Beach, Hidden Beach, Matinloc Shrine, Helicopter Island, Small Lagoon, Cadlao Lagoon, Pasandigan Beach and Paradise Beach.

sources.snippet: One of the most enchanting destinations in El Nido is the world‚Äôs famous Shimizu Island. Known for its iconic name and majestic black limestone mountains which perfectly compliments its crystalline turquoise waters, Shimizu Island is definitely a picturesque destination you‚Äôd want to cast yourself away at. Aside from its heavenly features that undoubtedly resemble a tropical paradise, Shimizu Island is also a haven for snorkeling hobbyists as the island is known for its abundant marine and aquatic life.
sources.shortName: 15 BEST BEACHES in PALAWAN (world-class islands and beaches)

sources.snippet: Shimizu Island is one of the best snorkeling spots in El Nido. It is named after a late Japanese scuba diver who‚Äôs believed to have died in an underwater tunnel on this island. Through its crystal-clear waters, you can see an abundant reef inhabited by some of the world‚Äôs stunning corals and various fishes.
sources.shortName: best el nido resorts Archives

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs either this island, or a similar that you will stop at for lunch. Lunch will always be a fresh BBQ consisting of fish, pork, chicken, rice, noodles, vegetables and fruit. It‚Äôs super delicious and you just dine on the beautiful beach.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Things To Do In El Nido [Philippines] In 2024

places.name: Shimizu Island

reviews.text: Beautiful island! We had lunch here on our island-hopping private tour. Lovely place, and if you come early enough, there are no other people at all ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Small Island in between Secret Lagoon and Big Lagoon. This island is also part of Tour A (most famous island hopping tour from El Nido). We had our lunch here on  boat, most boats do the same and did some snorkling here. The water is so clear and blue , just loved it. Many varities of fish out there.

First time to visit here, the shimizu island this place is super awesome and its even more captivating and beautiful than the pictures itself, white sand clear water you can see the bottom of the sea, sorrounded by beautiful water and rock formation..you need to ride a boat to get here...

places.generalDescription: Star Beach, located on Tapiutan Island, is a secluded and privately owned white-sand beach with crystal-clear waters and abundant marine life. Although it's not included in some island-hopping tours due to high rates, it offers a serene atmosphere backed by impressive karst towers. This underrated destination provides an opportunity for visitors to enjoy the powdery white sands and azure waters without the crowds. It's also renowned for snorkeling, boasting a wide swimming area with thriving aquatic life underneath.

sources.snippet: On the El Nido Hidden Beaches and Island Hopping Tour you will discover Helicopter Island, Hidden Beach, Star Beach, Secret Beach and the Matinloc Shrine.
sources.shortName: El Nido Hidden Beaches & Island Hopping
El Nido Palawan Beach Heaven

places.name: Star Beach

reviews.text:
One of the best snorkeling spots. Crystal clear water and stunning panoramic view of limestones.

You won't be able to go to the beach because it's a private property.
What a stunning place. My boat tour stopped just next to Star beach to snorkel. It was amazing. A great number of fish and sea life. We also saw turtles. Best spot so far to snorkeling ü•∞
This is a private beach but you can go snorkeling there as part of Tour C package. Still beautiful as compared to the nearby beaches ‚ù§Ô∏èüòç

places.generalDescription: Entalula Island is an exclusive destination accessible to guests of the El Nido Resort. It boasts pristine beaches and excellent snorkeling opportunities. The island offers a tranquil ambiance, with white sand beaches and clear waters perfect for water activities. While more remote than surrounding islands, it provides a serene escape from the hustle and bustle of daily life. Visitors can enjoy the simple pleasures of wooden beach-beds and grilled dishes at the nearby bed and breakfast resort.

sources.snippet: Entalula Island was originally a private island located off-shore of mainland El Nido. Only guests from the nearby island resort El Nido Resorts Miniloc Island and El Nido Resorts Lagen Island (more on these below) were allowed entry. But a small portion of Entalula Island was opened to the public for some reason.
sources.shortName: Ultimate List of Amazing Islands and Beaches in El Nido Palawan

sources.snippet: If its stillness and serenity that you‚Äôre after, this peaceful island in El Nido is the perfect spot for you. A dreamy white sand beach, Entalula Island gives you that perfect relaxation vibe with all the comforts of home.
sources.shortName: The 12 Most Beautiful Unspoiled Islands of El Nido

places.name: Entalula Island

reviews.text:
If you book island hopping at El Nido, this island should be included in the trip. There is  a beach, sunbathing area, water shop and table (100 Php) for lunch.
The water is crystal clear and it is quite relaxing to stay here for 1-2 hours.
Absolutely stunning!! One of the best places we've seen in the world. Highly recommend visiting as part of the island hopping tour!
Amazing island! The most beautiful in Palawan

places.generalDescription: Nestled between the beach and cliffs, Matinloc Shrine is an abandoned religious symbol on Matinloc Island in El Nido. The shrine features a white dome and a statue of the Virgin Mary under a small pavilion, making it a picturesque spot sheltered by limestone karsts. Visitors can explore this site as part of Tour C, which also includes stops at Helicopter Island, Secret Beach, Hidden Beach, and Star Beach.

sources.snippet: Formerly a house for the nuns until it got abandoned, the Matinloc Shrine‚Äîlocated somewhere in Matinloc Island‚Äîis more for thrill-seekers and adventurers than your average travelers to see. However, if you are not after the remnants of the shrine, then the waters surrounding the place may be the reason for the visit.
sources.shortName: 18 Must-See Beaches in El Nido, Palawan

sources.snippet: You reach this beautiful shrine by climbing the steps of an abandoned building. There is a chapel on top and you‚Äôll be greeted with a stunning panoramic view.

places.name: Matinloc Shrine

reviews.text: Amazing place! Breathtakingly beautiful! Even if our way there is super wavy, it's all worth it. My favorite part of the tour!

We visited Matinloc Shrine on 2nd April 2023. You're probably on Tour C now and are here to try to figure out whether or not to pay 200 pesos to enter Matinloc Shrine. My advice is don't bother. There are a couple of concrete effigies of Jesus, a concrete statue of Mary, a bizarrely constrasting concrete effigy of Marcos, and some unfinished ruins of buildings. They clearly need the money to complete the construction works, so there is absolutely no need for you to contribute to the building costs. We loved Tour C, and the natural world we experienced with the beaches, views and photo opportunities. In my opinion you can skip Matinloc Shrine and you haven't missed anything. Oh it does have a lovely viewpoint between the rocks from up fairly high. That's the only nice part though, and not even worth 40 pesos never mind 200 pesos. I have genuinely no idea how this tourist attraction is getting nearly 5 star reviews on Google.  Hope this helps!

Total waste of time.

This is part of Tour C, but an extra 200 pesos per person are asked. Not worth it.

You only step up a few stairs and the view isn't much better than simply from the boat, the shrine does not offer anything to see. Better to just swim a little longer in the water at other stops.
