places.generalDescription: Vellago Resort is a small boutique hotel located on Seven Commandos Beach in El Nido, accessible only by boat. The resort offers exclusive accommodation options including the Beach Villa, Honeymoon Suite, King Room, and Queen Room. Guests can enjoy the restaurant and beach bar with a diverse menu. The resort provides activities such as snorkeling, kayaking, and island hopping for adventurous travelers. Couples can indulge in personalized romantic dinners or private massages for a more intimate experience.

sources.snippet: Wondering where to stay in El Nido for a romantic beach getaway?. Vellago Resort is the perfect answer. This luxurious boutique hotel is nestled at the end of Seven Commando Beach, one of the most picturesque spots in El Nido.
sources.shortName: Where to Stay in El Nido, Palawan: 4 Best Areas

places.name: Vellago Resort

reviews.text:
This will probably be one of the best reviews that I can give. Saying that "the stay here is worth it" is an understatement!¬† First of all, the location, the aesthetic of the resort, and the island itself is one of the most beautiful places that you can go to in El Nido! Conveniently located at the seven commando beach, when the tourists are not there the location itself makes it almost exclusive. The clarity and the color of the water itself is beautiful and specially during the sunny days you just can't help but swim. They offer free kayaking and snorkeling and the coral formations down below are outstanding and the fishes were pretty too. The mountain ranges were Instagram able and the sunset was amazing.

All the staffs and the personnel were really hospitable. From the arrival itself the airport pickup was helpful. Then when we arrived at the bay area, Captain Fiddy and Roy carried our big luggages while it was raining and even kept it from touching the ground and the sea shore. He was a great captain and our speedboat travel was really comfortable even though it was raining hard during our arrival. At the shore when we arrived, we were already being greeted by ALL the staffs and they were waving at us from afar! They were waving for about 5-10 minutes even when we were not there yet, and when we arrived they even helped us and washed the sands from our feet. Now that's premium service! And even the dogs were welcoming too. There were resident dacshunds: max and zorro, and some other dogs as well (Pedo, Brownie, Bella). Ed and Fran ushered us perfectly into our room and explained everything well.

Coming to the room itself, we can immediately feel the serenity and the lux vibe. It was a mixture of tropical and luxury essence. There was a custom welcoming board/ leaf and we felt more welcomed.

Then come the lunch time and dinner time. The food was perfect and we couldn't pick any flaw from it. The chef was really talented and the food was really great. As they say, chef's kiss! We also availed for the romantic dinner which was supposedly by the seashore. It was raining hard though but they made some adjustments and still made a romantic arrangement at the view deck.

Last but not the least, Bambi was one of the most amazing managers/ staff. He was really polite, attentive to our needs and friendly. He was great all around and it felt like he was a personal friend. He even went kayaking with us while we were snorkeling too.

TL;DR: if you are looking for an exclusive place to stay in El Nido, this is one of the sweetest spots. Don't mind the negative reviews because from A-Z you won't regret it.

Exceeded all expectations by far!  Staff helped with a romantic dinner with a proposal that was absolutely amazing.  They helped me through the entire process from start to finish.  The setup was breathtaking, and staff beyond accommodating. Please consider for future stays and special events. ‚ù§Ô∏è

I honestly don't know where to start-this place surpassed every expectation I had and then some. From the moment we arrived, the staff welcomed us with incredible warmth, presenting us with beautiful shell necklaces and a refreshing welcome drink before guiding us to a private, candlelit dinner on the beach, complete with tiki torches.

The resort looks just like the pictures online-if not better-and the team here is outstanding. Everyone was exceptionally kind, attentive, and genuinely went above and beyond to ensure our comfort. Having traveled to 22 countries, I've never encountered such a high level of luxury and exclusivity.

No detail was missed in our sea villa. The staff personally carried our bags to the room, which was perfectly prepared with a handmade sign and matching beautiful flowers. The villa itself was spacious, featuring an outdoor daybed and a balcony with direct access to the beach. The views from the bedroom were simply breathtaking.
The food was incredible, especially the breakfast, which was delivered to our villa so we could enjoy it in privacy while taking in the beach views.

The resort is located on the famous Seven Commando Beach. While many visitors come here to explore, guests at Vellago have the privilege of their own private beach area with a comfortable cabana. I highly recommend taking advantage of the complimentary snorkeling and kayaking.

If you're considering booking, don't hesitate. This is truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Our stay was unforgettable, made even more special by the amazing staff. A huge thank you to Bambi and Rozel for making our trip so comfortable and memorable.

places.generalDescription: On your third day in El Nido, you have the chance to unwind and explore the stunning surroundings or indulge in one of three exciting add-on tours. Among these is Tour D, which takes you to some hidden gems like Small Lagoon and Cadlao Lagoon, culminating at the serene Paradise Beach. This picturesque spot boasts soft white sands framed by swaying coconut trees and crystal-clear aquamarine waters‚Äîan idyllic setting for relaxation away from bustling crowds.

sources.snippet: From the El Nido port, it is just barely visible in the distance. In hindsight, we realize this is a daunting task, but kayaking to Cadlao Island is also insanely rewarding and worth every ounce of sweat it takes you to get there. If you‚Äôre not one for exhausting yourself while on vacation, you can escape the labor by taking Tour D to this beach!
sources.shortName: 10 Blissful Beaches in El Nido (That You Can See WITHOUT A Tour!)
El Nido Palawan Beach Heaven

places.name: Paradise Beach

reviews.text:
Gorgeous beach which is a part of the tour D itinerary. The sand is very fine and the trees provide great shade.
The beach was clean when we visited

Rented a kayak in El Nido and paddled about 20min to get here, we had the whole beach to ourselves for 45min before we decided to move on to the next one! Definitely recommend it's paradise like the name suggests üòé

Nice secluded little beach, I did the El Nido island hopping tour D which makes a short stop here. On the beach there was a starving pregnant cat that was just skin and bones, going around at the beach screaming for help. You could feel her bones when petting her üò¢. If you are going to this beach please bring her food and help her.

places.generalDescription: Snake Island, also known as Vigan Island, is a serene and picturesque destination with white-sand beaches and a unique sandbar that appears only at low tide. The island is famous for its winding sandbar that connects it to the mainland, providing an incredible opportunity to stroll along and enjoy the feeling of being in a deserted paradise. There are shallow swimming areas on both sides of the sand strip, making it perfect for leisurely dips in the clear waters.

sources.snippet: Snake Island Beach, also known as Vigan Island, one of the must-see stops, has grown in popularity due to its distinctive S-shaped sandbar that appears during low tide. Visitors can walk the entire length of the sandbar and enjoy swimming. A short hike up to the viewpoint on that island is recommended for an overlooking view.
sources.shortName: Discover Top Beaches in El Nido, Palawan (12 Beaches) ‚Äì Big Dream Boatman

places.name: Snake Island

reviews.text: When we arrived, we were on the sandbar alone.  What an amazing place, like from a postcard! Private tour was well worth it as we came here before all the crowds ‚ò∫Ô∏è
A spit sand dune walkable at low tide and viewed as light coloured strip when under water. A bit gritty sand not white soft powder and not the most picturesque we've seen but popular.
Awesome View at the top. definitely go for the short hike. It was high tide when we visited, but we saw a lot of starfishes and was overall a great experience
